## Course Overview

This course examines foundational and applied aspects of human motor control through an integrated approach to movement across the lifespan.

::: {.incremental}
- Focus on perception-action loop
- Links between sensation, cognition, and movement
- Applications to rehabilitation and clinical practice
- Engagement with current research
:::

## Learning Objectives

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

::: {.incremental}
1. Describe approaches to understanding motor control
2. Apply knowledge of sensorimotor structures
3. Explain theories of motor control
4. Design evidence-based exercises
5. Critique current motor control research
6. Reflect on historical evolution of motor control theories
:::

## Group Project Overview

This course includes a major group project where you'll investigate a movement disorder:

::: {.incremental}
- Work in assigned groups (check Canvas > People > Groups)
- Develop expertise in a specific movement disorder
- Create and record a professional presentation
- Engage with peer presentations and provide feedback
:::

[View complete presentation guidelines](../../assig-presentation.qmd)

## Movement Disorders

Choose from disorders such as:

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- Parkinson's disease
- Cerebral palsy
- Multiple sclerosis
- Huntington's disease

::: {.column width="50%"}
